mapper.sql: id, EnterpriseId, messageContent, orderInfoId, backContent, doneContent, createTime, serviceState
mapper.insert: insert into t_locksmith_enterprise_complain (id, EnterpriseId, messageContent, orderInfoId, backContent, doneContent, createTime, serviceState) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{enterpriseId,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{messageContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{orderInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{backContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{doneContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{serviceState,jdbcType=INTEGER})

id,
EnterpriseId,
messageContent,

backContent,

mapper.update:
update t_locksmith_enterprise_complain
EnterpriseId = #{enterpriseId,jdbcType=BIGINT},
messageContent = #{messageContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
orderInfoId = #{orderInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
backContent = #{backContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
doneContent = #{doneContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
createTime = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
serviceState = #{serviceState,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update t_locksmith_enterprise_complain set EnterpriseId = #{enterpriseId,jdbcType=BIGINT}, messageContent = #{messageContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, orderInfoId = #{orderInfoId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, backContent = #{backContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, doneContent = #{doneContent,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, createTime = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, serviceState = #{serviceState,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select:
select c.*,o.orderNo,e.enterpriseName from t_locksmith_enterprise_complain c left join t_orderinfo o on c.orderInfoId=o.id left join t_locksmith_enterprise e on c.EnterpriseId=e.id
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and e.enterpriseName like concat ('%', #{enterpriseName},'%')
and c.messageContent like concat ('%', #{messageContent},'%')

select
from t_locksmith_enterprise_complain c
where 1=1
and c.id = #{id}
and c.EnterpriseId like concat ('%', #{enterpriseId},'%')
and c.messageContent like concat ('%', #{messageContent},'%')
